poem:
Elon Sleeps Uneasy

In the carbide glare  
of screens—  
tweets flash  
like flocks of birds  
pecking at  
detested laws,  
their shadow  
lingering in  
the digital dawn—  
an empire in code,  
stitching  
new sky,  
metal wings,  
other lands.  
Regulation whispers  
through pixel trees—  
he listens,  
eyes unsleeping,  
amid quiet revolutions.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Elon Musk’s beef with Britain isn’t (only) about politics. It’s about tech regulation For those wondering why Elon Musk, the tycoon newly infamous for his stiff-arm salutes, developed a sudden ferocious interest in the UK this month, the answer may lie in an arcane piece of online media legislation working its way gradually towards fruition. In a ferocious flurry of tweets of his X platform this month, days before formally joining the Trump administration, the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
